name: waddling
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
waddle
(usually of a person or animal with short legs and a fat body) to walk with short steps, moving the body from one side to the other: The ducks waddled down to the river. A short, fat waiter waddled over. Compare
toddle
totter
More examplesFewer examplesThe penguins waddled on their rocks and swam in their pool.The door jingled and an elderly female customer waddled in.Choosing a key from a ring which hung round his fat waist, the guard waddled past a number of cells.
